Lack enough support: The claim that Trump "didn't campaign on cutting the debt" lacks enough support as it is contradicted by statements and promises made by Trump during his campaign.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Trump's campaign promises are the sole determinant of his actions as president, which may not necessarily be the case.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as Trump did address the national debt during his campaign and proposed ways to reduce it.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Trump did address the national debt during his campaign and made promises to reduce it.
Understate: The claim may understate the extent to which Trump campaigned on cutting the debt, as there is evidence of his commitment to addressing the national debt during his campaign.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not fully acknowledging Trump's statements and promises regarding the national debt during his campaign.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent to which Trump did not campaign on cutting the debt, as there is evidence of his focus on addressing the national debt during his campaign.
